title: The Last Sunspot
premise: A perpetually cheerful solar witch, whose magic is fueled by joy, is forced into a reluctant partnership with a reclusive gloomweaver—a being who draws power from shadows and sorrow. To prevent an eternal eclipse that would doom both their kinds, they must learn to blend their opposing magics, a process that requires a dangerous emotional symbiosis. As the celestial event approaches, their survival depends on the one thing they find impossible: him learning to hope, and her learning to embrace the dark.
protagonist: Elara, a solar witch whose enforced optimism hides a deep fear of her own fading light.
conflict: Their essential natures are magically and emotionally incompatible, yet they must achieve perfect harmony to perform a ritual that stops the eternal eclipse, all while fighting a forbidden attraction that could destabilize their powers completely.
setting: Present-day, in the cloistered, magic-steeped coastal town of Penumbra Cove, a hidden nexus where celestial and shadow realms thinly veil.
tone: Atmospheric, yearning, and emotionally charged, balancing whimsical charm with gothic melancholy.
